DOC.HEAD: Plane Missing Since Christmas Found in New Jersey
DOC.TEXT: Three bodies were found this morning in the wreckage of a small airplane that crashed in a rural section of southern New Jersey, state police spokesman Daniel Cosgrove said. The Cessna 172 was spotted at 7:50 a.m. in the Wharton State Forest. The plane had taken off from Teterboro Airport in northern New Jersey on Monday night, headed to Norfolk, Va., and then to the Bahamas, according to Maj. Andrew Pantelides of the New Jersey Civil Air Patrol. The Cessna was traveling with two other planes that landed safely in Atlantic City, Pantelides said. He said passengers aboard those planes became concerned after the Cessna did not arrive and a search began that night. Seven aircraft and about 65 rescue workers searched a 50 mile area between Toms River and Atlantic City until the aircraft was found this morning in Burlington County, Pantelides said. The names of the dead were not immediately released.
